question: Which country houses "Gironde Estuary"?
explanation: The Gironde Estuary is a navigable estuary located in southwest France and is formed from the meeting of the rivers Dordogne and Garonne just downstream of the center of Bordeaux. It is the largest estuary in western Europe. This estuary is a part of the Gironde estuary and Pertuis Sea Marine Nature Park. This estuary was the location of the Operation Frankton of the Second World War.
